member.name: T:JSPool.EngineMetadata

member.name: T:JSPool.FileWatcher
member.summary: Handles watching for changes to files.

member.name: F:JSPool.FileWatcher.DEFAULT_DEBOUNCE_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Default value for .

member.name: F:JSPool.FileWatcher._watcher
member.summary: FileSystemWatcher that handles actually watching the path.

member.name: F:JSPool.FileWatcher._watchedFiles
member.summary: Files to watch within the watched path.

member.name: F:JSPool.FileWatcher._timer
member.summary: Timer for debouncing changes.

member.name: E:JSPool.FileWatcher.Changed
member.summary: Occurs when any watched files have changed (including renames and deletions).

member.name: P:JSPool.FileWatcher.DebounceTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time period to debounce file system changed events, in milliseconds. This is useful to handle when multiple file change events happen in a short period of time. JsPool will not reload/recycle the engines until this period elapses.

member.name: P:JSPool.FileWatcher.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to watch.

member.name: P:JSPool.FileWatcher.Files
member.summary: Gets or sets the files to watch in the path. If no files are provided, every file in the path is watched.

member.name: M:JSPool.FileWatcher.Start
member.summary: Starts watching for changes in the specified path.
member.returns: Whether creation of the watcher was successful

member.name: M:JSPool.FileWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stops watching for changes in the specified path.

member.name: M:JSPool.FileWatcher.OnFileChanged(System.Object,System.IO.FileSystemEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles events fired when any files are changed.
member.param: The instance containing the event data

member.name: M:JSPool.FileWatcher.OnTimer(System.Object)
member.summary: Handles events fired when any files are changed, and the changes have been debounced.

member.name: M:JSPool.FileWatcher.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Handles watching for changes to files.

member.summary: Occurs when any watched files have changed (including renames and deletions).

member.name: P:JSPool.IFileWatcher.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to watch.

member.name: P:JSPool.IFileWatcher.Files
member.summary: Gets or sets the files to watch in the path. If no files are provided, every file in the path is watched.

member.summary: Starts watching for changes in the specified path.
member.returns: Whether creation of the watcher was successful

member.name: M:JSPool.IFileWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stops watching for changes in the specified path.

member.name: T:JSPool.IJsPool
member.summary: Handles acquiring JavaScript engines from a shared pool. This class is thread safe.

member.name: T:JSPool.IJsEngineWithOwnThread
member.summary: An adapter for implementations that always need to be used from the same thread they are created on.

member.name: P:JSPool.IJsEngineWithOwnThread.IsThreadAlive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the execution status of this engine's thread.

member.name: T:JSPool.IJsPool`1
member.summary: Handles acquiring JavaScript engines from a shared pool. This class is thread safe.

member.name: M:JSPool.IJsPool`1.GetEngine(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Gets an engine from the pool. This engine should be returned to the pool via when you are finished with it. If an engine is free, this method returns immediately with the engine. If no engines are available but we have not reached yet, creates a new engine. If MaxEngines has been reached, blocks until an engine is avaiable again.
member.param: Maximum time to wait for a free engine. If not specified, defaults to the timeout specified in the configuration.
member.exception: Thrown if no engines are available in the pool within the provided timeout period.

member.name: M:JSPool.IJsPool`1.ReturnEngineToPool(`0)
member.summary: Returns an engine to the pool so it can be reused

member.name: P:JSPool.IJsPool`1.EngineCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of engines in this engine pool, including engines that are currently busy.

member.name: P:JSPool.IJsPool`1.AvailableEngineCount
member.summary: Gets the number of currently available engines in this engine pool.

member.name: M:JSPool.IJsPool`1.DisposeEngine(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the specified engine
member.param: If true, a new engine will be created to replace the disposed engine

member.name: M:JSPool.IJsPool`1.Recycle
member.summary: Disposes all engines in this pool, and creates new engines in their place.

member.summary: Handles acquiring JavaScript engines from a shared pool. This class is thread-safe.

member.summary: Gets a factory method used to create engines.

member.summary: Determines if the specified engine can only be used on the thread it is created on.
member.returns: true if the engine should be confined to a single thread

member.summary: Runs garbage collection for the specified engine

member.summary: Contains the configuration information for JSPool

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPoolConfig.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new JavaScript pool configuration. Default values will be set automatically.

member.name: T:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread
member.summary: An adapter for implementations that always need to be used from the same thread they are created on. This class creates a thread for the engine and marshalls all method calls to that thread.

member.name: T:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.ThreadWorkItem
member.summary: Represents a method being executed on the JsEngine thread.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.ThreadWorkItem.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the method to execute.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.ThreadWorkItem.Exception
member.summary: Gets or sets the exception that occurred while executing the method. If no exception has occurred, this will be null.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.ThreadWorkItem.Result
member.summary: Gets or sets the result of the method invocation.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.ThreadWorkItem.WaitForCompletion
member.summary: Event to signal when method execution has completed.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.THREAD_STACK_SIZE
member.summary: Stack size to use for the threads.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._innerEngineFactory
member.summary: Method used to create instances.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._innerEngine
member.summary: JsEngine used by this thread.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._thread
member.summary: The thread the engine runs on.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._cancellationToken
member.summary: Token used to signal that the thread should be shut down.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._disposedCancellation
member.summary: Token used to stop the thread when the engine has been disposed

member.name: F:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread._queue
member.summary: Queue of method calls to run on the thread.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.#ctor(System.Func{JavaScriptEngineSwitcher.Core.IJsEngine},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Token used to signal that the thread should be shut down.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.WriteLog(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a log message for debugging purposes. Only logs when compiled with TRACE flag.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.RunThread
member.summary: Runs in the thread for this engine. Loops forever, processing items from the queue.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.RunOnThread(System.Func{JavaScriptEngineSwitcher.Core.IJsEngine,System.Object})
member.summary: Runs the specified method on the engine thread, and returns its result as an object. Blocks until the method has been executed.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.RunOnThread``1(System.Func{JavaScriptEngineSwitcher.Core.IJsEngine,``0})
member.summary: Runs the specified method on the engine thread, and returns its result as an instance of . Blocks until the method has been executed.
member.typeparam: Type of data returned by the method

member.name: M:JSPool.JsEngineWithOwnThread.RunOnThread(System.Action{JavaScriptEngineSwitcher.Core.IJsEngine})
member.summary: Runs the specified method on the engine thread. Blocks until the method has been executed.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating the execution status of this engine's thread.

member.summary: Handles acquiring JavaScript engines from a shared pool. This class is thread-safe.

member.summary: Configuration for this engine pool.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._availableEngines
member.summary: Engines that are currently available for use.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._metadata
member.summary: Metadata for the engines. Total number of engines that have been created is reflected in its Count.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._engineFactory
member.summary: Factory method used to create engines.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._fileWatcher
member.summary: Handles watching for changes to files, to recycle the engines if any related files change.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._cancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Used to cancel threads when disposing the class.

member.name: F:JSPool.JsPool`1._engineCreationLock
member.summary: Lock object used when creating a new engine

member.name: E:JSPool.JsPool`1.Recycled
member.summary: Occurs when any watched files have changed (including renames and deletions).

member.summary: Creates a new JavaScript engine pool
member.param: The configuration to use. If not provided, a default configuration will be used.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.CreateEngineFactory
member.summary: Gets a factory method used to create engines.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.InitializeWatcher
member.summary: Initializes a if enabled in the configuration.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.PopulateEngines
member.summary: Ensures that at least engines have been created.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.CreateEngine
member.summary: Creates a new JavaScript engine and adds it to the list of all available engines.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.GetEngine(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Gets an engine from the pool. This engine should be returned to the pool via when you are finished with it. If an engine is free, this method returns immediately with the engine. If no engines are available but we have not reached yet, creates a new engine. If MaxEngines has been reached, blocks until an engine is avaiable again.
member.param: Maximum time to wait for a free engine. If not specified, defaults to the timeout specified in the configuration.
member.exception: Thrown if no engines are available in the pool within the provided timeout period.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.TakeEngine(`0)
member.summary: Marks the specified engine as "in use"

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.ReturnEngineToPool(`0)
member.summary: Returns an engine to the pool so it can be reused

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.DisposeEngine(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes the specified engine.
member.param: If true, a new engine will be created to replace the disposed engine

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.DisposeAllEngines
member.summary: Disposes all engines in this pool. Note that this will only dispose the engines that are *currently* available. Engines that are in use will be disposed when the user attempts to return them.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.Recycle
member.summary: Disposes all engines in this pool, and creates new engines in their place.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes all the JavaScript engines in this pool.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPool`1.CollectGarbage(`0)
member.summary: Runs garbage collection for the specified engine

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPool`1.EngineCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of engines in this engine pool, including engines that are currently busy.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPool`1.AvailableEngineCount
member.summary: Gets the number of currently available engines in this engine pool.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPool`1.DebuggerDisplay
member.summary: Gets a string for displaying this engine pool in the Visual Studio debugger.

member.name: T:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1
member.summary: Contains the configuration information for JSPool

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.StartEngines
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of engines to initially start when a pool is created. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.MaxEngines
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of engines that will be created in the pool. Defaults to 25.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.GetEngineTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the default timeout to use when acquiring an engine from the pool. If an engine can not be acquired in this timeframe, a will be thrown.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.Initializer
member.summary: Gets or sets the code to run when a new engine is created. This should configure the environment and set up any required JavaScript libraries.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.EngineFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the function method used to create engines. Defaults to the standard JsEngineSwitcher factory method.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.MaxUsagesPerEngine
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times an engine can be reused before it is disposed. 0 is unlimited.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.GarbageCollectionInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times an engine can be reused before its garbage collector is ran. Only used if the engine supports garbage collection (V8).

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.WatchPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to watch for file changes. If any files in this path change, all engines in the pool will be recycled

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.WatchFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the file paths to watch for file changes. Requires to be set too. If not set, all files in will be watched.

member.name: P:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.DebounceTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time period to debounce file system changed events, in milliseconds. This is useful to handle when multiple file change events happen in a short period of time. JsPool will not reload/recycle the engines until this period elapses.

member.name: M:JSPool.JsPoolConfig`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new JavaScript pool configuration. Default values will be set automatically.

member.name: T:JSPool.Exceptions.JsPoolExhaustedException
member.summary: Thrown when no engines are available in the pool.

member.name: M:JSPool.Exceptions.JsPoolExhaustedException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:JSPool.Exceptions.JsPoolExhaustedException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:JSPool.Exceptions.JsPoolExhaustedException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:JSPool.Exceptions.JsPoolExhaustedException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Used by deserialization
